title: Meaning of $$n$$
text: The $$n$$ denotes the dimension of the input vectors of $$x$$, which means that the input vectors $$x$$ have two components.

title: Property of Linear Functions
text: Linear functions preserve vector addition. For example, $$f{\left(x+y\right)}=f{\left(x\right)}+f{\left(y\right)}$$.

title: Property of Linear Functions
text: Linear functions also must preserve scalar multiplication. For example, $$f(cx)=cf(x)$$ for a constant value c.

title: Linear Combinations
text: The name for the function that preserves both vector addition and scalar multiplication is a function that preserves linear combinations.

title: Checking if a function is linear
text: To check if a function is linear, input example vectors to check that linear combinations are preserved.

title: Simple Checking
text: The easiest vectors to input into the function to check for linearity are the elementary basis vectors e_1,...,e_n

title: Checking by Plugging in
text: Does the function satisfy scalar multiplication when an inputted vector is multiplied by $$-1$$ and the output is also multiplied by -1?
